intro: Oxalis urbica, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves resembling those of clover. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, often appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its stems are hairy and its leaves are heart-shaped with reddish veins. Oxalis urbica is often found in moist, shady areas such as woodland floors and along stream banks.
